items.title: Steal this Qi2 15W 3-in-1 charging station for your Apple everyday carry while it’s just $13 – doesn’t get much less than that (68% off)
items.summary:
ESR 15W Qi2 3-in-1 charging station

Buy for $13 (Reg. $40)

What we love

You’ll come across plenty of Qi2-certified chargers on the market – including some of the newer 25W Qi2.2 options – but it’s rare to find one priced at just $13. That makes this one of the most budget-friendly Qi2 chargers we’ve turned the spotlight on. It packs a 15W Qi2 wireless charging pad with MagSafe support for your iPhone, plus dedicated spots for both your Apple Watch and AirPods. All in all, a solid charging station for Apple users looking to save a few bucks.

more…

items.summary: Flipkart is set to become the most valuable startup to shift its headquarters back to India ahead of a planned IPO.

items.title: 'Shining star in the sky' highlights Denmark's drone anxiety
items.summary: COPENHAGEN (Reuters) -Denmark's second-biggest airport, Billund, was briefly shut early on Friday following a report of illegal drone activity that police later identified as "a shining star in the sky," amid heightened concern over drone sightings nationwide. Read full story

items.title: Sultan Sharafuddin grants audience to Dr Zaliha, Amir Hamzah
items.summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The Sultan of Selangor, Sultan Sharafuddin Idris Shah, on Friday (Sept 26) granted an audience to Minister in the Prime Minister's Department (Federal Territories) Datuk Seri Dr Zaliha Mustafa and Finance Minister II Datuk Seri Amir Hamzah Azizan at Istana Bukit Kayangan, Shah Alam. Read full story

items.title: Going fast: New Beats woven USB-C cables hit Amazon all-time lows from $13 Prime shipped (53% off)
items.summary:
Update 9/26: Select colors are already starting to go out of stock, get in there at the all-time low pricing below while you still can.

As we reported earlier this spring, Apple’s Beats brand stepped into a new product category this year – USB-C cables. This comes on the heels of its first iPhone cases last September and the launch of this year’s collection (they are already on sale right here), and now we are tracking the first price drops on the new Beats cables at Amazon starting from $12.99 Prime shipped. Details below.

items.title: Samsung’s ultra-thin Galaxy S25 Edge is starting to go back up in price, grab one now at $400 off while you still can
items.summary:
Update 9/26: This particularly notable deal is still live, but it appears it won’t be for much longer as select colors of the most affordable model are already starting to jump back up price. 

You can still land $300 off the Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 7, but with Apple’s new Phone Air making headlines everywhere, we wanted to highlight the straight up $400 cash discount on the Samsung S25 Edge. All things considered, the S25 Edge actually has the edge in some respects on Apple’s ultra-thin new phone – it was really just the expensive price tag on the S25 Edge that turned most Android users off. That said, you can land one right now at Amazon with a giant $400 discount. 

more…

items.title: Kremlin says talk of shooting down Russian planes is a serious escalation of tensions
items.summary: MOSCOW (Reuters) -The Kremlin said on Friday that talk of shooting down Russian military planes over Europe was reckless, aggressive and marked a serious escalation of tension near Russia's border. Read full story

items.title: Just $20 gets you Sharge’s ultra-portable Flow Mini 2 power bank with built-in USB-C lanyard cable
items.summary:
Sharge Flow Mini 2 5K power bank with built-in cable

Buy for $20 (Reg. $30)

What we love

This is one of the more compact power banks Sharge has it in its lineup, and it packs a 5,000mAh battery. What we love about this model is that it comes with both USB-C and Lightning connectors, allowing you to easily switch between them depending on the device you’re charging. Notably, it also has a built-in USB-C cable that doubles as a handy lanyard.

items.title: Thailand to seek referendum on Cambodia border demarcation
items.summary: BANGKOK (Reuters) -Thailand's prime minister said on Friday that his government will propose a referendum on whether to revoke two agreements on the demarcation of its border with Cambodia as part of a plan to address a simmering dispute with its neighbour. Read full story
